mil.emp3.api.interfaces

Interface IMap

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IContainer, org.cmapi.primitives.IGeoBase, org.cmapi.primitives.IGeoContainer

    public interface IMap
extends IContainer
    This interface defines the access to a map instance. It is implemented by the MapFragement and MapView classes.

      This methods places the map into freehand draw mode if no exception is raised and EditorMode changes to FREEHAND_MODE.

      This methods places the map into freehand draw mode if no exception is raised.

      This method selects the features listed.

      This method sets the maps viewing area to the coordinates contained in the bounding box provided.
      void setCamera(ICamera camera, boolean animate)
      This method sets the map's camera therefore changing the viewing area of the map.
      void setFarDistanceThreshold(double dValue)
      This method sets the threshold of the distances beyond which the map displays MilStd single point icons as dots.

      This method changes the style used by the freehand operation.

      This method set the size that all icons are displayed.

      This method sets the map's lookAt therefore changing the viewing area of the map.
      void setMidDistanceThreshold(double dValue)
      This method sets the threshold of the distances beyond which the map displays MilStd single point icons with no modifiers.
      void setMilStdLabels(MilStdLabelSettingEnum labelSetting)
      This method indicates to the map engine which MilStd labels to display.
      void setMirrorCacheMode(MirrorCacheModeEnum mode)
      Used to set the operational mode for MirrorCache.
      void setMotionLockMode(MapMotionLockEnum mode)
      This method set the map's motion lock.

      This method performs the visibility action on the target object under the specified parent on this map.

      This method performs the visibility action on all the target objects listed under all of there parents on this map.

      This method performs the visibility action on the target object under all of its parents on this map.

      This method performs the visibility action on the targets identified on the list under all of their parents on this map.

      This method performs the visibility action on the target object under the specified parent on this map.

      This method performs the visibility action on the target object identified by the targetId under all of its parents on this map.
      IMap swapMapEngine(IEmpPropertyList properties)
      This method will swap the current map instance with a new one.
      void zoomTo(IFeature feature, boolean animate)
      This methods centers the map with the features location at the center.
      void zoomTo(IOverlay overlay, boolean animate)
      This method calculates the bounding box of the content of the overlay and sets the maps viewing area to contain the bounding box.
      void zoomTo(java.util.List<IFeature> featureList, boolean animate)
      This method calculates the bounding box that contains all the features listed and sets the maps view area to contain the bounding box.

    • Method Detail

      • setMirrorCacheMode

        void setMirrorCacheMode(MirrorCacheModeEnum mode)
        Used to set the operational mode for MirrorCache.
        Parameters:
        mode - the operational mode for MirrorCache

      • isEgressEnabled

        boolean isEgressEnabled()
        Used to determine if egress is enabled. If true, local map changes will be synchronized remotely.
        Returns:
        true if egress is enabled, false otherwise.

      • isIngressEnabled

        boolean isIngressEnabled()
        Used to determine if ingress is enabled. If true, remote map changes will be synchronized locally.
        Returns:
        true if ingress is enabled, false otherwise.

      • getState

        MapStateEnum getState()
        Describes the state of this IMap implementation instance. For a description of the different states see mil.emp3.api.enums.MapStateEnum
        Returns:
        MapStateEnum

      • getScreenCapture

        ICapture getScreenCapture()
        This method request a screen capture from the map.
        Returns:
        See ICapture or null if it is not supported by the map implementation.

      • getCamera

        ICamera getCamera()
        This method retrieves the map's current camera.
        Returns:
        ICamera

      • setCamera

        void setCamera(ICamera camera,
             boolean animate)
               throws EMP_Exception
        This method sets the map's camera therefore changing the viewing area of the map. The map registers for camera change events for the camera and will update the map viewing area on each change event.
        Parameters:
        camera - This parameter must contain the new camera setting to be applied to map's viewing area.
        animate - If set to true then map will animate to the new position
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - The exception is raised if a processing error is encountered.

      • getLookAt

        ILookAt getLookAt()
        This method retrieves the map's current lookAt.
        Returns:
        ILookAt

      • setLookAt

        void setLookAt(ILookAt lookAt,
             boolean animate)
               throws EMP_Exception
        This method sets the map's lookAt therefore changing the viewing area of the map. The map registers for lookAt change events for the lookAt and will update the map viewing area on each change event.
        Parameters:
        lookAt - This parameter must contain the new lookAt setting to be applied to map's viewing area.
        animate - If set tto true then map will animate to the new position.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - The exception is raised if a processing error is encountered.

      • getAllFeatures

        java.util.List<IFeature> getAllFeatures()
        This method retrieves a list of all features currently plotted in the map.
        Returns:
        This method returns a java.util.List of IFeature objects.

      • getAllOverlays

        java.util.List<IOverlay> getAllOverlays()
        This method retrieves a list of all overlays currently plotted in the map.
        Returns:
        This method returns a java.util.List of IOverlay objects.

      • addOverlay

        void addOverlay(IOverlay overlay,
              boolean visible)
                throws EMP_Exception
        This method adds an overlay container to the root of the map.
        Parameters:
        overlay - This parameter defines the overlay container.
        visible - True if the overlay is to be made visible, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - The exception is raised if a processing error is encountered.

      • addOverlays

        void addOverlays(java.util.List<IOverlay> overlays,
               boolean visible)
                 throws EMP_Exception
        This method adds the overlay containers on the provided list to the root of the map.
        Parameters:
        overlays - This parameters is a java.util.ArrayList of one or more overlay containers.
        visible - True if the overlays are to be made visible, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - The exception is raised if a processing error is encountered.

      • removeOverlay

        void removeOverlay(IOverlay overlay)
                   throws EMP_Exception
        This method removes an overlay containers from the root of the map.
        Parameters:
        overlay - This parameters defines the overlay that is to be removed from the root of the map.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - The exception is raised if a processing error is encountered.

        Parameters:
        overlays - This parameters is a java.util.ArrayList of one or more overlay containers.
        Throws:

        Returns:

      • setVisibility

        void setVisibility(IContainer target,
                 VisibilityActionEnum actionEnum)
                   throws EMP_Exception
        This method performs the visibility action on the target object under all of its parents on this map.
        Parameters:
        target - The object to perform the action on. (See IOverlay, IFeature)
        actionEnum - The action to perform. See VisibilityActionEnum.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - If the target is not on the map or the target is not an overlay or feature.

      • setVisibility

        void setVisibility(IContainerSet targetList,
                 VisibilityActionEnum actionEnum)
                   throws EMP_Exception
        This method performs the visibility action on all the target objects listed under all of there parents on this map.
        Parameters:
        targetList - A list of one or more objects to perform the action on. (See IOverlay, IFeature)
        actionEnum - The action to perform. See VisibilityActionEnum.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - If any target is not on the map or not an overlay or feature.

      • setVisibility

        void setVisibility(java.util.UUID targetId,
                 VisibilityActionEnum actionEnum)
                   throws EMP_Exception
        This method performs the visibility action on the target object identified by the targetId under all of its parents on this map.
        Parameters:
        targetId - The unique identifier of the object to perform the action on.
        actionEnum - The action to perform. See VisibilityActionEnum.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - If the target identified by the Id is not on the map or is not an overlay or feature.

        actionEnum - The action to perform. See VisibilityActionEnum.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - If the target identified by the Id is not on the map or is not an overlay or feature.

      • setVisibility

        void setVisibility(IContainer target,
                 IContainer parent,
                 VisibilityActionEnum actionEnum)
                   throws EMP_Exception
        This method performs the visibility action on the target object under the specified parent on this map.
        Parameters:
        target - The object to perform the action on. (See IOverlay, IFeature)
        parent - The parent object of the target that the action will be applied to,
        actionEnum - The action to perform. See VisibilityActionEnum.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - If the target (or parent) are not on the map, or the target (or parent) are not an overlay or feature.

      • setVisibility

        void setVisibility(java.util.UUID targetId,
                 java.util.UUID parentId,
                 VisibilityActionEnum actionEnum)
                   throws EMP_Exception
        This method performs the visibility action on the target object under the specified parent on this map.
        Parameters:
        targetId - The Id of the object to perform the action on. (See IOverlay, IFeature)
        parentId - The Id of the parent object of the target that the action will be applied to,
        actionEnum - The action to perform. See VisibilityActionEnum.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - If the target (or parent) are not on the map, or the target (or parent) are not an overlay or feature.

      • getVisibility

        VisibilityStateEnum getVisibility(IContainer target)
        This method retrieves the visibility of the target object on the map.
        Parameters:
        target - The object of which the visibility state is requested. (See IOverlay, IFeature)
        Returns:
        VisibilityStateEnum.VISIBLE - indicates that the object is visible on the map and its child objects visibility depends on their individual visibility states. VisibilityStateEnum.HIDDEN - indicates that the object is not visible on the map and its child objects visibility state depend on their visibility state with other parent objects null - If the target object is not on the map or not an overlay or feature.

      • getVisibility

        VisibilityStateEnum getVisibility(IContainer target,
                                IContainer parent)
        This method retrieves the visibility of the target object on the map.
        Parameters:
        target - The object of which the visibility state is requested. (See IOverlay, IFeature)
        parent - A parent of the target object of which the visibility state is requested. (See IOverlay, IFeature)
        Returns:
        VisibilityStateEnum.VISIBLE - indicates that the object is visible on the map and its child objects visibility depends on their individual visibility states. VisibilityStateEnum.HIDDEN - indicates that the target object under the specified parent is marked to be not visible on the map. The target objects actual visibility depends on its visibility setting under another parent if it has others. VisibilityStateEnum.VISIBLE_ANCESTOR_HIDDEN - indicates that the target object under the specified parent is marked to be visible on the map, however no ancestral path from the parent to this root map is visible. null - If the target (or parent) object are not on the map or not an overlay or feature.

      • addMapStateChangeEventListener

        EventListenerHandle addMapStateChangeEventListener(IMapStateChangeEventListener listener)
                                                   throws EMP_Exception
        This method registers a listener for map state change events.
        Parameters:
        listener - The object that implements the proper handler for the map state change event.
        Returns:
        EventListenerHandle A handle to the registration which is needed to unregister the listener.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - The exception is raised if the listener is null.

      • addMapInteractionEventListener

        EventListenerHandle addMapInteractionEventListener(IMapInteractionEventListener listener)
                                                   throws EMP_Exception

        Parameters:
        listener - The object that implements the proper handler for the user interaction event.
        Returns:
        EventListenerHandle A handle to the registration which is needed to unregister the listener.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - The exception is raised if the listener is null.

        Returns:
        EventListenerHandle A handle to the registration which is needed to unregister the listener.
        Throws:

        Returns:
        a registration handle which is needed to unregister the listener.

        Returns:

        Throws:

        Throws:

      • swapMapEngine

        IMap swapMapEngine(IEmpPropertyList properties)
                   throws EMP_Exception
        This method will swap the current map instance with a new one.
        Parameters:
        properties - The property key value pair needed to support map swapping. The required properties are Property.ENGINE_CLASSNAME and Property.ENGINE_APKNAME if the map is implemented in an APK.
        Returns:
        The new android.view.View object for the new map instance.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - The exception is raised if a processing error is encountered.

      • editFeature

        void editFeature(IFeature oFeature)
                 throws EMP_Exception
        This method places the specified feature into edit mode and EditorMode changes to EDIT_MODE.
        Parameters:
        oFeature - The specified feature
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - The exception is raised if a processing error is encountered. I.E. If the feature is currently not on this map, or the map can't edit a feature of that type, or there is a draw or edit in progress or MapMotionLockMode is LOCK/SMART_LOCK.

      • editFeature

        void editFeature(IFeature oFeature,
               IEditEventListener listener)
                 throws EMP_Exception
        This method places the specified feature into edit mode and EditorMode changes to EDIT_MODE.
        Parameters:
        oFeature - The specified feature
        listener - A listener to handler the edit session events. This listener is unregistered when the edit session is completed or canceled.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - The exception is raised if a processing error is encountered. I.E. If the feature is currently not on this map, or the map can't edit a feature of that type, or there is a draw or edit in progress or MapMotionLockMode is LOCK/SMART_LOCK.

      • cancelEdit

        void cancelEdit()
                throws EMP_Exception
        This method cancels the edit session on the feature and EditorMode changes to INACTIVE.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - The exception is raised if a processing error is encountered. I.E. If the feature is currently not on this map, or the feature is not in edit mode.

      • completeEdit

        void completeEdit()
                  throws EMP_Exception
        This method instructs the map to complete the edit session on the feature. All the changes are updated in the core and and EditorMode changes to INACTIVE.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - The exception is raised if a processing error is encountered. I.E. If the feature is currently not on this map, or the feature is not in edit mode.

      • drawFeature

        void drawFeature(IFeature oFeature,
               IDrawEventListener listener)
                 throws EMP_Exception
        This method instructs the map to draw the feature specified and EditorMode changes to DRAW_MODE
        Parameters:
        oFeature - The specified feature
        listener - A draw event listener that will received the draw event. This listener will be unregistered when the draw if complete or canceled.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - The exception is raised if a processing error is encountered. I.E. If the map is already drawing or editing, or the map can't draw a feature of that type, or MapMotionLockMode is LOCK or SMART_LOCK.

      • drawFeature

        void drawFeature(IFeature oFeature)
                 throws EMP_Exception
        This method instructs the map to draw the feature specified and EditorMode changes to DRAW_MODE
        Parameters:
        oFeature - The specified feature
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - The exception is raised if a processing error is encountered. I.E. If the map is already drawing or editing, or the map can't draw a feature of that type.

      • cancelDraw

        void cancelDraw()
                throws EMP_Exception
        This method cancels the draw session and EditorMode changes to INACTIVE.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - The exception is raised if a processing error is encountered. If the map is NOT in draw mode the call has no effect.

      • completeDraw

        void completeDraw()
                  throws EMP_Exception
        This method instructs the map to complete the draw session and EditorMode changes to INACTIVE. All the changes are updated in the core.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - The exception is raised if a processing error is encountered. If the map is not in draw mode this call has no effect.

      • drawFreehand

        void drawFreehand(org.cmapi.primitives.IGeoStrokeStyle initialStyle)
                  throws EMP_Exception
        This methods places the map into freehand draw mode if no exception is raised and EditorMode changes to FREEHAND_MODE.
        Parameters:
        initialStyle - This parameters contains the initial style to use for the draw. A value of null causes an EMP_Exception.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - if the map does not support free hand drawing, or there is a draw or edit in progress, or MapMotionLockMode is LOCKED or SMART_LOCK.

      • drawFreehand

        void drawFreehand(org.cmapi.primitives.IGeoStrokeStyle initialStyle,
                IFreehandEventListener listener)
                  throws EMP_Exception
        This methods places the map into freehand draw mode if no exception is raised. The user can use drag gestures to draw lines on the map.

        When entering freehand mode:
        1) - The map is locked in smart lock mode.
        2) - A MAP_ENTERED_FREEHAND_DRAW_MODE event is generated.
        3) - At the first drag gesture a MAP_FREEHAND_LINE_DRAW_START is generated when the first N points (N > 1) have been drawn. As the drawing takes place a line with the specified style is displayed on the map.
        4) - A MAP_FREEHAND_LINE_DRAW_UPDATE event is generated as the user continues the drag gesture.
        5) - When the user ends the drag gesture (lifts the finger or stylist), a MAP_FREEHAND_LINE_DRAW_END event is generated. The event shall contain a list of geospatial coordinates of the line drawn. Once the event return the line is removed from the map, and the list of coordinates are deleted.
        6) - The user may choose to initiate a new drag gesture to generate a new line therefore returning to step # 3.
        7) - When drawComplete is called a MAP_EXIT_FREEHAND_DRAW_MODE is generated, the map is unlocked, 8) - EditorMode changes to FREEHAND_MODE and the map exits freehand draw mode.
        Parameters:
        initialStyle - This parameters contains the initial style to use for the draw. A value of null causes an EMP_Exception.
        listener - This parameters is an event listener to handle the freehand draw events.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - if the map does not support freehand drawing, or there is a draw or edit in progress, map is MapMotionLockMode is LOCKED or SMART_LOCK.

      • setFreehandStyle

        void setFreehandStyle(org.cmapi.primitives.IGeoStrokeStyle style)
                      throws EMP_Exception
        This method changes the style used by the freehand operation.
        Parameters:
        style - A value of null has no effect.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - if the map is not in freehand drawing.

      • drawFreehandExit

        void drawFreehandExit()
                      throws EMP_Exception
        This method causes the map to exit freehand draw mode and EditorMode changes to INACTIVE. If the map is NOT in draw mode the call has no effect.
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception - if the map is not in freehand drawing.

      • zoomTo

        void zoomTo(IFeature feature,
          boolean animate)
        This methods centers the map with the features location at the center. This call has no effect if feature is null or has no coordinates.
        Parameters:
        feature - The feature to center on.
        animate - If set tto true then map will animate to the new position

      • zoomTo

        void zoomTo(java.util.List<IFeature> featureList,
          boolean animate)
        This method calculates the bounding box that contains all the features listed and sets the maps view area to contain the bounding box. (NOTE: a 3D map may not be able to show all the features listed.)
        Parameters:
        featureList -
        animate - If set tto true then map will animate to the new position

      • zoomTo

        void zoomTo(IOverlay overlay,
          boolean animate)
        This method calculates the bounding box of the content of the overlay and sets the maps viewing area to contain the bounding box. The viewing area is not changed if the overlay is empty or not on the map.
        Parameters:
        overlay -
        animate - If set tto true then map will animate to the new position

      • setBounds

             boolean animate)

        Parameters:
        bounds -
        animate - If set tto true then map will animate to the new position

      • setMotionLockMode

        void setMotionLockMode(MapMotionLockEnum mode)
                       throws EMP_Exception
        This method set the map's motion lock. It will throw an exception if any one of the following conditions is true Map is already in one of the supported lock modes (LOCK or SMART_LOCK) EditorMode is not INACTIVE.
        Parameters:
        mode - see MapMotionLockEnum
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception

      • getMotionLockMode

                                    throws EMP_Exception

        Returns:
        current map motion mode. see MapMotionLockEnum
        Throws:
        EMP_Exception

      • setFarDistanceThreshold

        void setFarDistanceThreshold(double dValue)
        This method sets the threshold of the distances beyond which the map displays MilStd single point icons as dots. Current default is 30000.0 meters.
        Parameters:
        dValue - Distance in meters.

      • getFarDistanceThreshold

        double getFarDistanceThreshold()
        This method retrieves the far distance threshold set on the map.
        Returns:
        The distance in meters.

      • setMidDistanceThreshold

        void setMidDistanceThreshold(double dValue)
        This method sets the threshold of the distances beyond which the map displays MilStd single point icons with no modifiers. Icons at distances less than this threshold get displayed as fully qualified icons as per the label setting on the map. Note that this is simply a hint for the system. If EMP core components detect a high level of memory usage this value will be adjusted in the hope of avoiding OutofMemoryError. When memory usage returns to normal an attempt is made to restore the threshold to user set value Current default is 10000.0 meters.
        Parameters:
        dValue - Distance in meters.

      • getMidDistanceThreshold

        double getMidDistanceThreshold()
        This method retrieves the mid distance threshold set by setMidDistanceThreshold. It is not necessarily the value that is actually in effect. Please see notes on setMidDistanceThreshold.
        Returns:
        The distance in meters.

      • selectFeature

        void selectFeature(IFeature feature)
        This method selects the feature on the map. If the feature is already selected, or not on the map no action is taken.
        Parameters:
        feature - The feature to select. NULL feature is ignored.

      • selectFeatures

        void selectFeatures(java.util.List<IFeature> features)
        This method selects the features listed. If a feature is already selected or not on the map no action is taken.
        Parameters:
        features - The list of features to select. NULL features are ignored.

      • deselectFeature

        void deselectFeature(IFeature feature)
        This method deselects the feature on the map. If the feature is not selected or not on the map no action is taken.
        Parameters:
        feature - The feature to deselected. NULL feature is ignored.

      • deselectFeatures

        void deselectFeatures(java.util.List<IFeature> features)
        This method deselects the features on the map. If any feature is not selected or not on the map no action is taken.
        Parameters:
        features - The features to deselected. NULL features are ignored.

      • getSelected

        java.util.List<IFeature> getSelected()
        This method retrieves the list of feature that are marked selected on the map.
        Returns:
        A list of IFeatures. If there are no features selected the list is empty.

      • clearSelected

        void clearSelected()
        This method clears the map selected list.

      • isSelected

        boolean isSelected(IFeature feature)
        This method check if the feature is selected on the map.
        Parameters:
        feature -
        Returns:
        True if it is selected false otherwise.
